intro: Hibbertia fruticosa, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has woody stems and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Hibbertia fruticosa is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is well adapted to the dry and sunny conditions of its native habitat. It plays an important role in attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
